attributes.action: Stop banks issuing 6 year fraud markers against children under 18.
attributes.additional_details: Banks allow 16 year old to easily open accounts online without education about the risks of money transfers and without proof of address and parental consent. I want banks to take some responsibility to protect our youngsters from being duped into this crime which they usually do not profit from. I want banks to reduce the length of time CIFAS markers are placed against children under 18 and banks to have a duty to provide basic bank accounts so that youngsters can work and study after this
attributes.background: Thousands of children are being duped into money laundering by transferring money because of adverts or promotions on social media. Once banks put a marker against their name they cannot have access to a uk bank account for 6 years to get student loans or wages paid in to and cannot work or study.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about taking action in the case of fraud is a matter for individual banks and fraud prevention bodies such CIFAS, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition asking the Government to raise the minimum age for an adult bank account to 18, if that's something you'd like to happen.
